commit_message:
Fix ProviderUsageBaseTestCase._run_periodics for multi-cell

The _run_periodics() method is using a non-targeted context
when running the update_available_resource method on all
computes created in the test. For tests that use multiple
cells where the compute services/nodes are created in multiple
cells, the periodic running on the non-cell1 services would
not find the ComputeNode because the context is not targeted.
By default, the CellDatabase fixture is targeted at cell1 in
the base TestCase._setup_cells() method, so when querying the
database without a targeted context, it will look in cell1
which could be wrong if you're trying to update resources in
cell2.

This fixes the issue by simply getting the CellMapping per host
and targeting the context before calling update_available_resource.

Change-Id: Ieeac3bdb82a23179ff6c652b2e9e05a3f6bc9032

commit_message:
Fix invalid escape sequence warning

Python 3.6 is more strict about special characters in regular strings if
they are invalid escape sequences. This most often happens in regex
strings. This fixes one instance by switching the regex string to use a
raw string.

Change-Id: I73a7393fe04c920c7d82a2fa68f1cf0c7d453a7d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Move to opendev

1.Use opendev.org instead of git.openstack.org.
2.Use review.opendev.org instead of review.openstack.org.

You can see the discussion below:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003603.html

Change-Id: Ice4509204df788a1a44a06fb89fb44cfe6b54b94

[{'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2019-02-12 23:41:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-02-13 01:17:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/636473/1 : SUCCESS in 1h 35m 51s'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-02-13 10:10:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

As you commented in the bug, this flag is available in iptables 1.6.2 [1]. This version was released on 2/2/2018. There are several OS without this version yet. E.g. (in my dev environment):
- Ubuntu 16.04 LTS: 1.6.0
- Ubuntu 18.04 LTS: 1.6.1
- Fedora 28: 1.8.0

I would suggest first to add a sanity check to test which version of iptables is being used. But we can't block OpenStack from running for this limitation. Sorry, but I can give you an alternative solution.

[1] https://www.netfilter.org/projects/iptables/downloads.html#iptables-1.6.2"}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2019-02-13 17:34:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree that this needs to check the version of iptables. A release note here might be a nice touch. I don't think we can assume a version of iptables. That is the only issue I see with this."}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2019-02-13 18:16:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'll work on an update to this"}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-04-10 17:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

It seems you repeat the following pattern many times:

  iptables_argument = "some set of iptables arguments"
  iptable_version = self.snat_iptables_manager.get_version()
  if iptable_version:
      version_compare = common_utils.is_version_greater(
            iptable_version, n_const.IPTBL_VERSION)
      if version_compare:
        iptables_argument = "some set of iptables arguments --random-fully"

It seems to me that there is a lot of code duplication here.  What if you did this instead:

  iptables_argument = "some set of iptables arguments"
  if self.snat_iptables_manager.version_supports_random_fully():
      iptables_argument = iptables_argument + " --random-fully"

Get rid of common_utils.is_version_greater() unless you foresee it being used somewhere else.  And replace snat_iptables_manager.get_version() with this:                                                         

  def version_supports_random_fully(self):
      args = ['iptables', '--version']
      version = self.execute(args, run_as_root=True).split()[1]
      version_str = version[1:]
      LOG.debug("IPTables version installed: %s", version_str)
      return (pkg_resources.parse_version(version_str) >=
              pkg_resources.parse_version(n_const.IPTBL_VERSION))
              
I think that would be more succinct.  Unless you have a separate need for a function that gets the iptables version and a separate function that compares versions then I think this is the best way to break down
the code.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-04-10 18:33:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-12 23:41:34.000000000', 'message': 'Packets getting lost during SNAT with too many connections

We have a problem with SNAT with too many connections using the
same source and destination on the network nodes.

In addition we can see in the conntrack table that the who
"instert_failed" increases.

This might be a generic problem with conntrack and linux.
We suspect that we encounter the following "limitation / bug"
in the kernel.

There seems to be a workaround to alleviate this behavior by
setting the -random-fully flag in iptables for port consumption.

This patch fixes the problem by adding the --random-fully to
the SNAT rules.

Change-Id: I246c1f56df889bad9c7e140b56c3614124d80a19
Closes-Bug: #1814002

commit_message:
Packets getting lost during SNAT with too many connections

We have a problem with SNAT with too many connections using the
same source and destination on the network nodes.

In addition we can see in the conntrack table that the who
"instert_failed" increases.

This might be a generic problem with conntrack and linux.
We suspect that we encounter the following "limitation / bug"
in the kernel.

There seems to be a workaround to alleviate this behavior by
setting the -random-fully flag in iptables for port consumption.

This patch fixes the problem by adding the --random-fully to
the SNAT rules.

Change-Id: I246c1f56df889bad9c7e140b56c3614124d80a19
Closes-Bug: #1814002

subject: Dropping the py35 testing
messages: [{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-04-22 03:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-04-24 02:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 23825, 'date': '2019-04-24 02:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-22 03:49:55.000000000', 'message': 'Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I1d60426db61a7a67bb2dda68a7fcfdd49bedb6dd
'}]
commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I1d60426db61a7a67bb2dda68a7fcfdd49bedb6dd

They do not use this.

commit_message:
Replace neutron CLI with openstack CLI

neutron CLI is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Use
openstack CLI instead.

Highlighted texts are now emphasized by "emphasize-lines" option
of the code-block directive.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I552171fe3e22290580e2cdff20adccf655573d03

As noted inline if you're forcing the host you're bypassing the scheduler filters and that's why you're risking the over-subscription (and failure) of resources. https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/add-host-and-hypervisor-hostname-flag-to-create-server.html will solve this, but there are other ways to still request a specific host and run through the filters:

-2 since this isn't a direction we should go."}, {'account_id': 28706, 'date': '2019-04-24 02:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yeah, some issues will be occurred when you use the forced_host and/or forced_node in AZ. It will bypass the scheduler filters.'}, {'account_id': 28706, 'date': '2019-04-24 02:32:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

As Matt said, we have a spec[1] to give another way to specify the target host and/or node in Train.
If nothing will be updated or discussed for this, I think it can be abandoned.
The implement of spec has been pushed here[2].

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/add-host-and-hypervisor-hostname-flag-to-create-server.html
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/645520/'}, {'account_id': 24268, 'date': '2019-04-24 02:41:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Update host_state's limits when specified AZ

- Create vms where specifies force_hosts, if request resource
  exceeds the total resource, the vms are spawned succeefully
  without error occurred, that was abnormal because resource
  filters(such as ram filter, disk filter) were specified.
- In this patch, When _schedule, update host's limits if filters
  specified. Spawning vms would be failed if requested resources
  were bigger than the usable resource.

Change-Id: Ib74599d123ceb1acffa68a6192e6635c878cfa0e
Closes-Bug: #1652335

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-16 01:57:18.000000000', 'message': 'Switch Manila API to httpd and support TLS

manila-api can be deployed in two ways:
- Using the service-provided eventlet based server
- Behind any popular web server as a wsgi process

The project team recommends using httpd over the
in-built eventlet based server to improve
performance, and also handle tls termination.

So, switch the manila-api docker/service to running
httpd, and add necessary configuration options.
Honor the "EnableInternalTLS" option to allow running
manila-api with TLS.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/652804/
Change-Id: Ic88a2f08e013a49e3da45a2bfc82c62ba284526a
(cherry picked from commit 1cb6886a21ebf131259ce5884264df32852b7067)
'}]
commit_message:
Switch Manila API to httpd and support TLS

manila-api can be deployed in two ways:
- Using the service-provided eventlet based server
- Behind any popular web server as a wsgi process

The project team recommends using httpd over the
in-built eventlet based server to improve
performance, and also handle tls termination.

So, switch the manila-api docker/service to running
httpd, and add necessary configuration options.
Honor the "EnableInternalTLS" option to allow running
manila-api with TLS.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/652804/
Change-Id: Ic88a2f08e013a49e3da45a2bfc82c62ba284526a
(cherry picked from commit 1cb6886a21ebf131259ce5884264df32852b7067)

Add wait.resource for LMA services to armada manifest

This adds the wait.resource.type to each LMA service in
the armada manifest

Change-Id: I86adbb1a5325ce2beef8506a406865e8db53876b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-22 17:08:05.000000000', 'message': 'Use py36 instead of py35 for periodic master jobs

OpenStack Train will test on py36 instead of py35, change the periodic
master jobs periodic-jobs-with-X-master to use py36.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/654571
Change-Id: I4408048391dc9a286d8d6ab8f8424a659b1b00ed
'}, {'created': '2019-04-22 17:12:28.000000000', 'message': 'Remove in-tree periodic job

The periodic job is defined in both openstack/project-config and here.
Remove it here and keep the version in project-config so that we can
update it easily for all projects for train.

Related changes:
* https://review.opendev.org/654571
* https://review.opendev.org/654574

Change-Id: I4408048391dc9a286d8d6ab8f8424a659b1b00ed
'}]
commit_message:
Remove in-tree periodic job

The periodic job is defined in both openstack/project-config and here.
Remove it here and keep the version in project-config so that we can
update it easily for all projects for train.

Related changes:
* https://review.opendev.org/654571
* https://review.opendev.org/654574

Change-Id: I4408048391dc9a286d8d6ab8f8424a659b1b00ed

commit_message:
Change ovs version we use in fullstack tests

Kernel 4.4.0-145 backported a change on IPv6 fragmentation API, so
update the OVS version checked out for fullstack tests to a hash
including the needed compatibility layer changes

Change-Id: Ia9383c02e1c62e31db9493729aedbed5b94a3a3f
Closes-bug: #1823155
(cherry picked from commit 004caf773abc73661981597abef54dd6389a98c1)

commit_message:
fix storage.yaml to write environments/storage/nova-nfs.yaml

Also add quotes to the nfs version as they are required in
the resulting nova-nfs.yaml .

NOTE: partial cherry-pick as we only need the quotes fix in
      queens.

Closes-Bug: #1825374

Change-Id: I209480f209e3a8841362ea619b1c9b073c89f338

> Please do not add any more testing to Keystone or other projects

 > 
 > Please join in to the general policy discussions, we meet in
 > Wednesdays on IRC and you should really understand the wider set of
 > efforts before continuing with this.

I'm happy to join the Keystone policy meetings (I was present yesterday). However, if I remember correctly, you tried to revert David Purcell's spec for Patrole here [0] -- therefore I'm curious whether you oppose RBAC testing or if you just want Keystone to do it instead in the future?

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410250/"}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2017-05-19 16:13:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

 > of
 > > efforts before continuing with this.

 > David Purcell's spec for Patrole here [0] -- therefore I'm curious
 > whether you oppose RBAC testing or if you just want Keystone to do
 > it instead in the future?
 > 
 > [0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410250/

I think the intended goal was to avoid having gate testing for RBAC at this current time since keystone is moving the check from policy.json to middleware. Having a testing tool for checking RBAC would be nice to have, but I agree that we shouldn't be pushing for more testing gates at this time until the policy issue is fixed."}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2017-05-25 05:11:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-02-28 16:48:04.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-03-13 21:00:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2018-03-13 21:59:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-04-05 17:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Patrole (RBAC) Keystone Gating

The purpose of this spec is to outline a proposal for adding RBAC
testing gates to Keystone by leveraging Patrole, a Tempest plugin.

This spec is targetted for Stein release.

Change-Id: Ie6cb4075091b363f0ad67bd6afec18f1789abc5a

commit_message:
fix storage.yaml to write environments/storage/nova-nfs.yaml

753a3504184d966c63121ca95bc0135afbc83a75 removed ceph entries
from sample-env-generator/storage.yaml which resulted in nova-nfs
and cinder-netapp-config to be in the same section. Therefore
environment_generator.py did not update the nova-nfs.yaml .

Also add quotes to the nfs version as they are required in
the resulting nova-nfs.yaml .

Closes-Bug: #1825374

Change-Id: I209480f209e3a8841362ea619b1c9b073c89f338
(cherry picked from commit 693556f22388c4debb585213e0bb89d28b60c12e)

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

HOST_IP only used by ipv4, SERVICE_HOST is used by ipv4 or ipv6.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-02 17:17:27.000000000', 'message': 'octavia container network address pool

octavia provider network address pool is incorrectly identified
by net_name field of a provider network

.. code-block:: yaml

     - network:
        container_bridge: "br-lbaas"
        container_type: "veth"
        container_interface: "eth14"
        host_bind_override: "eth14"
        ip_from_q: "octavia"
        type: "flat"
        net_name: "octavia"
        group_binds:
          - neutron_linuxbridge_agent
          - octavia-worker
          - octavia-housekeeping
          - octavia-health-manager

In the example ip_from_q and net_name confusingly have the same
value octavia. However ip_from_q refers to cidr_network i.e. address pool
and net_name refers to physical network.

container_network name "octavia_address" comes from ip_from_q value.

Change-Id: Ibbe4636e9b92f2967cbf89a585b8c84a8a56668c
(cherry picked from commit 4bed7d3410c1eee461c54d175b0838102f1e9572)
'}, {'created': '2019-04-22 19:19:40.000000000', 'message': 'octavia container network address pool

octavia provider network address pool is incorrectly identified
by net_name field of a provider network

.. code-block:: yaml

     - network:
        container_bridge: "br-lbaas"
        container_type: "veth"
        container_interface: "eth14"
        host_bind_override: "eth14"
        ip_from_q: "octavia"
        type: "flat"
        net_name: "octavia"
        group_binds:
          - neutron_linuxbridge_agent
          - octavia-worker
          - octavia-housekeeping
          - octavia-health-manager

In the example ip_from_q and net_name confusingly have the same
value octavia. However ip_from_q refers to cidr_network i.e. address pool
and net_name refers to physical network.

container_network name "octavia_address" comes from ip_from_q value.

Change-Id: Ibbe4636e9b92f2967cbf89a585b8c84a8a56668c
(cherry picked from commit 4bed7d3410c1eee461c54d175b0838102f1e9572)
'}]
commit_message:
octavia container network address pool

octavia provider network address pool is incorrectly identified
by net_name field of a provider network

.. code-block:: yaml

     - network:
        container_bridge: "br-lbaas"
        container_type: "veth"
        container_interface: "eth14"
        host_bind_override: "eth14"
        ip_from_q: "octavia"
        type: "flat"
        net_name: "octavia"
        group_binds:
          - neutron_linuxbridge_agent
          - octavia-worker
          - octavia-housekeeping
          - octavia-health-manager

In the example ip_from_q and net_name confusingly have the same
value octavia. However ip_from_q refers to cidr_network i.e. address pool
and net_name refers to physical network.

container_network name "octavia_address" comes from ip_from_q value.

Change-Id: Ibbe4636e9b92f2967cbf89a585b8c84a8a56668c
(cherry picked from commit 4bed7d3410c1eee461c54d175b0838102f1e9572)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I2e4cbc31b49a395750e5f48ac111a45e1cc1b25b
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Update openstackdocstheme options

Require at least version 1.20 and cleanup the conf.py files and use
newer option settings.

As part of cleanup remove many unused options and comments.

Change-Id: I2d43c43a2825f592502116683162edaa387e6d26

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-17 21:49:36.000000000', 'message': 'Update Prereqs for the Denver Summit

Due to the shortened format of the Denver Summit we
need to make sure that the trainees do more work before the
summit than we normally have to.  This adds steps to the
page to get the trainees to do more setup before the Summit.
It also adds a number of warnings to the trainees about the
importance of preparing.

Finally, this includes a link to the new VM image for
the Denver Summit.

Change-Id: I3ad612450b24d15d1d9d308f22c49c22f742d9d6

the Denver Summit.

Change-Id: I3ad612450b24d15d1d9d308f22c49c22f742d9d6
'}]
commit_message:
Update Prereqs for the Denver Summit

Due to the shortened format of the Denver Summit we
need to make sure that the trainees do more work before the
summit than we normally have to.  This adds steps to the
page to get the trainees to do more setup before the Summit.
It also adds a number of warnings to the trainees about the
importance of preparing.

Finally, this includes a link to the new VM image for
the Denver Summit.

Change-Id: I3ad612450b24d15d1d9d308f22c49c22f742d9d6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-19 14:55:08.000000000', 'message': 'Only set oslo_messaging_notifications.driver if using RPCFixture

nova.tests.unit.test_rpc.TestRPC does not use the RPCFixture which
means the base test class setup can fail to set the test notification
driver if the oslo.messaging options, configured via the RPCFixture,
are not set, which results in:

  oslo_config.cfg.NoSuchGroupError: no such group [oslo_messaging_notifications]

This change fixes the issue by only setting that option if using
the RPCFixture.

Change-Id: I960638acd14b17ffbb8db3b1dd765b26de4e93f7
Closes-Bug: #1825535
'}]
commit_message:
Only set oslo_messaging_notifications.driver if using RPCFixture

nova.tests.unit.test_rpc.TestRPC does not use the RPCFixture which
means the base test class setup can fail to set the test notification
driver if the oslo.messaging options, configured via the RPCFixture,
are not set, which results in:

  oslo_config.cfg.NoSuchGroupError: no such group [oslo_messaging_notifications]

This change fixes the issue by only setting that option if using
the RPCFixture.

Change-Id: I960638acd14b17ffbb8db3b1dd765b26de4e93f7
Closes-Bug: #1825535

[{'created': '2019-04-22 16:50:04.000000000', 'message': "Check for file existance in file modification check

We sometimes start health checks before a file is actually written out
by the service. This results in a bash error in the logs. Let's check
the file exists before trying to use it in the health check.

Change-Id: I58815050117af20abc547f46d15073ac0bf8ca74
Closes-Bug: #1824246
(cherry picked from commit 26967343482ff1df5976d4da2d5b598e364362cf)
"}]
commit_message:
Check for file existance in file modification check

We sometimes start health checks before a file is actually written out
by the service. This results in a bash error in the logs. Let's check
the file exists before trying to use it in the health check.

Change-Id: I58815050117af20abc547f46d15073ac0bf8ca74
Closes-Bug: #1824246
(cherry picked from commit 26967343482ff1df5976d4da2d5b598e364362cf)

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I33259f7b56d2f485b4981c0d664cc9fa553a3d71

commit_message:
[Core] Improve the readability of the get_console method.

Reduce the with and try keep only the statement to read the file.
Refactoring, use getattr instead a condition. Remove the useless else,
the value of log_path is already none by the get.

Change-Id: I112409f248f0c4ae93b2469b12b740148d225542

commit_message:
Use just release file at reproducer if present

In case the job that we want to reproduce is using the output from emit
releases script, reproducer has to use just that otherwise upgrade jobs
will fail.

Change-Id: I8c144b6dab59fba2b10e190c8b0afd7580bfffba
Closes-Bug: #1823688

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-22 14:15:30.000000000', 'message': 'Rely on artg_rdo_packages to inject gating repo

Currently inject gating repo is triggered based on
repo_built.skipped. This is wrong as repo_built.skipped
is defined if the last project in the dependency change
is skipped.
This patch fixes it by relying on artg_rdo_packages
variable. So whenever atleast 1 rdo packge is built
inject repo will be triggered.

Related-Bug: #1815744
Change-Id: I3c363c82c12b356e9073289a6912edd878b0f6ab
'}]
commit_message:
Rely on artg_rdo_packages to inject gating repo

Currently inject gating repo is triggered based on
repo_built.skipped. This is wrong as repo_built.skipped
is defined if the last project in the dependency change
is skipped.
This patch fixes it by relying on artg_rdo_packages
variable. So whenever atleast 1 rdo packge is built
inject repo will be triggered.

Related-Bug: #1815744
Change-Id: I3c363c82c12b356e9073289a6912edd878b0f6ab

commit_message:
Allow to override kolla-build rpm config

Added role variable: buildcontainers_rpm_setup_config,
this can be used to override kolla rpm config.

Also removed duplicated call to tripleo-repos and
bindep role. Those roles are already called in
tripleo-buildcontainers pre playbook. This was missed
in original patch[1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/652027/

Change-Id: I8397aab1dd57d8f67c6b0b300a6150da719ab7c4

commit_message:
Remove extraneous first def of required_interfaces

During a copy/paste two copies of required_interfaces static assignment
are included in the charm class.  The 2nd overrides the first, so this
commit simply removes the first.

Change-Id: I5d1622a02db43da01d3b0b7f1ce47a82799bc64a
Closes-Bug: #1826017

in contributor/index.rst.
Update URLs in other places as well though there are redirects.

See the following URLs for more details:

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I4a3416c240a0cd605491019739378f0e6acd0b0a

According to this addition, will we have to introduce/add this condition for each test? I mean, in tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps tests if we want to run them with RHEL, then we will have to change the test?'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-04-18 08:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)

> According to this addition, will we have to introduce/add this
 > condition for each test? I mean, in tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps
 > tests if we want to run them with RHEL, then we will have to change
 > the test?

No. You can configure RHEL image as default image and it will be used in every test in same way like cirros is. For most of the tests it doesn't matter what image is used.
But there is couple of tests which really require "advanced" image because cirros don't have all necessary features to run such test. And for those tests we are doing this change to allow user to say in tempest's config file "my default image is advanced and You can use it for this test too and it should work".'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2019-04-23 10:38:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

This is making test cases that requires images even more complex to write. Why not to add additional advanced image to the cloud instead and let test cases to decide witch one to use? Those few test cases that require an advance images could be easily skept if only base image is available. Please note that in most of cases a CirrOS image is better than an advanced one because it is cheaper to run (VMs booting time is probably the major time killer in our tempest based CI jobs). Therefore I see no good reason not having two separate images and let test cases to decide which one to use, instead of forcing test cases having only one. Test cases are already too complex and tempest.conf managing too. Test cases are already too slow and time consumed doing unnecessary operations like booting an advanced image instead a cirros one has a visible cost for CI infrastructure should be better spent running more tests.'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2019-04-23 10:38:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-04-23 11:00:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

> This is making test cases that requires images even more complex to
 > write. Why not to add additional advanced image to the cloud
 > instead and let test cases to decide witch one to use? Those few
 > test cases that require an advance images could be easily skept if
 > only base image is available. Please note that in most of cases a
 > CirrOS image is better than an advanced one because it is cheaper
 > to run (VMs booting time is probably the major time killer in our
 > tempest based CI jobs). Therefore I see no good reason not having
 > two separate images and let test cases to decide which one to use,
 > instead of forcing test cases having only one. Test cases are
 > already too complex and tempest.conf managing too. Test cases are
 > already too slow and time consumed doing unnecessary operations
 > like booting an advanced image instead a cirros one has a visible
 > cost for CI infrastructure should be better spent running more
 > tests.

In upstream CI, where we are using devstack it is totally true that it's better to use cirros and it is easy to configure to images. And that is still done here.

But please note that it is easy to configure two images easy because we are using neutron-tempest-plugin's devstack plugin which can download proper image, upload it to glance and set its ID in tempest's config file.

Unfortunatelly it isn't the case always e.g. in D/S CI (like we have in RH for example). If there is no devstack used to deploy cloud, there is no easy way to download another image and configure it in tempest's config file.
So, if in such CI job already e.g. RHEL image is used as guest image, it may be very trivial change to add only this one config option with boolean value there and test will run and use "default" image as an advanced one.

Please also note that using advanced image like RHEL or Ubuntu shouldn't be very expensive if nested virtualisation can be used. Unfortunatelly we can't use it in U/S CI as it causes some problems on some cloud providers. That's why it is much easier for us to use 2 different images to makes test run faster.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-04-23 11:11:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

I don't have any problem with this, and I think it is a good solution given the problem at hand."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-04-23 12:42:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

'}, {'created': '2018-11-21 16:34:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix test-trunk tests based on NFV ci failures

NFV CI is running this tests continuously
This patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609762/16/neutron_tempest_plugin/config.py
broke CI, since it removed plugin_option image_is_advanced, type boolean.
So our suggestions here, is to add another var check to if query.
In this case, we use the advanced_image_ref as non None var as indicator for
image_is_advanced instead, and apply another Non check advanced_image_flavor_ref.
Once can still use compute.flavor_ref compute.image_ref as non cirros.

Change-Id: Ic78ee64a9350863ff5bd4b4baa4b20770e1b9d47

commit_message:
Add additional config option "default_image_is_advanced"

In patch [1] we added new config option to configure "advanced" image
which we are using in some tests which require it and can't run using
default Cirros image.
Unfortunatelly this made life of some downstream users harder as they
have CI systems which don't use devstack and don't have easy way to
load another "advanced" image and use it for those tests.

So now this patch adds one ore config option "default_image_is_advanced"
which has boolean value and defaults to False.
If this is set to True, tests which require advanced image will not be
skipped and default image will be used for those tests.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609762/16/neutron_tempest_plugin/config.py

Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ic78ee64a9350863ff5bd4b4baa4b20770e1b9d47

commit_message:
Fix image fetching process for leap 15

This patch fixes suse 15 container_image file retrievment process,
as aria2c does not save image under the correct name as it's a
metafile.

This reverts commit 6c9e26e965b98b7c1d38a3003a5a2c018f896db6.
Change-Id: I45647062c5766f1f9d4dd098f107e91caf52a3d7

Alright, printf'ed this thing and found that instance.availability_zone is indeed never updated without the fix, however, the API is capable of returning AZ based on instance.host instead of the instance's availability_zone attribute.

[14:23:55]  <melwitt>	so the AZ is still the original all the way to the end of the live migration. so how is the servers.get API returning the new AZ... the search continues
[14:25:57]  <mriedem>	i think i know
[14:26:07]  <mriedem>	the api code looks up the az from the instance.host
[14:26:13]  <mriedem>	i think
[14:26:21]  <melwitt>	pulled from the DB, the AZ is still the original in instance.availability_zone
[14:26:25]  <melwitt>	ahhhh
[14:26:40]  <melwitt>	must be, it can't be looking at instance.availability_zone
[14:26:42]  <mriedem>	there are other bugs for that behavior
[14:26:50]  <melwitt>	THANKS API
[14:26:55]  <mriedem>	https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/views/servers.py#L185
[14:27:16]  <melwitt>	le sigh
[14:27:18]  <mriedem>	https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/availability_zones.py#L165
[14:27:33]  <mriedem>	yeah if instance.host is not None, that code gets the az from the host aggregate, not the instance.az
[14:27:59]  <mriedem>	ala https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582342/
[14:28:00]  <melwitt>	well, that explains it"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-19 22:34:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-10 23:30:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add implicit instance AZ + live migration test

While triaging bug 1768876 there was some concern
that change I8d426f2635232ffc4b510548a905794ca88d7f99
in Pike had regressed some behavior where a user that
does not explicitly request a specific AZ during server
create is then later restricted to only move operations
within that same AZ.

This test shows that is not a regression because the
AvailabilityZoneFilter looks at RequestSpec.availability_zone
rather than instance.availabililty_zone, so the instance
is free to be moved across zones.

Change-Id: I9f73c237923fdcbf4096edc5aedd2c968d4b893e
Related-Bug: #1768876
'}, {'created': '2018-05-17 17:10:59.000000000', 'message': "Update instance.availability_zone during live migration

While triaging bug 1768876 there was some concern
that change I8d426f2635232ffc4b510548a905794ca88d7f99
in Pike had regressed some behavior where a user that
does not explicitly request a specific AZ during server
create is then later restricted to only move operations
within that same AZ.

This test shows that is not a regression because the
AvailabilityZoneFilter looks at RequestSpec.availability_zone
rather than instance.availabililty_zone, so the instance
is free to be moved across zones.

As a result of the test, however, it was noticed that
the instance.availability_zone isn't updated during live
migration once the destination host is selected. The other
move operations like unshelve, evacuate and cold migrate
all update the instance.availabiltiy_zone, so this copies
the same logic.

Change-Id: I9f73c237923fdcbf4096edc5aedd2c968d4b893e
Closes-Bug: #1771860

commit_message:
Update instance.availability_zone during live migration

While triaging bug 1768876 there was some concern
that change I8d426f2635232ffc4b510548a905794ca88d7f99
in Pike had regressed some behavior where a user that
does not explicitly request a specific AZ during server
create is then later restricted to only move operations
within that same AZ.

This test shows that is not a regression because the
AvailabilityZoneFilter looks at RequestSpec.availability_zone
rather than instance.availabililty_zone, so the instance
is free to be moved across zones.

As a result of the test, however, it was noticed that
the instance.availability_zone isn't updated during live
migration once the destination host is selected. The other
move operations like unshelve, evacuate and cold migrate
all update the instance.availabiltiy_zone, so this copies
the same logic.

Change-Id: I9f73c237923fdcbf4096edc5aedd2c968d4b893e
Closes-Bug: #1771860
Related-Bug: #1768876

subject: update availablity_zone in the instances table after live-migration

You can check the migration workflow, which is very long and I was planning to put it here, but I felt it still cannot be very clear.

My main point is that, according to the workflow, when doing moving action, during the filtering process the filter uses 'request_spec' for filtering, it is saved in API_DB and was generated when you boot the server, the change you made here won't change that value and also won't do anything in the migration process."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-03-30 09:11:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

[{'created': '2017-08-06 06:56:13.000000000', 'message': "update availablity_zone in the instances table  when live-migration successes

When you do a live-migration for an instance from one zone to
another successfully or you change the zone of the compute node
which the instance launched on, but the availablity_zone of this
instance in the instances table won't be updated.
Then when you do a cold_migrate or resize the instance,
the AvailabilityZoneFilter will get a wrong zone of the instance,
which is the availablity_zone in the instances table, and the filter
result must be wrong, and maybe it result in failure if the availablity_zone
in the instances table is removed or renamed.

So we update availablity_zone in the instances table
when live-migration successes

commit_message:
update availablity_zone in the instances table after live-migration

When you do a live-migration for an instance from one zone to
another successfully or you change the zone of the compute node
which the instance launched on, the availablity_zone of this
instance in the instances table won't be updated.
Then when you do a cold_migration or resize the instance,
the AvailabilityZoneFilter will get a wrong zone of the instance,
which is the availablity_zone in the instances table, and the filter
result would be wrong, and it maybe result in a failure if the
availablity_zone in the instances table is removed or renamed.

So we update availablity_zone in the instances table
when live-migration successes

Change-Id: Ie8c98084c51a09d5963f0b38233af10cfa247875
Close-Bug: #1677097

It looks like the az sent to create the port (via device_owner field) is getting a random value:

http://logs.openstack.org/76/181776/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full/d32662d/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_2015-05-12_08_50_44_685

That used to be compute:nova and I believe tempest is hard-coded to check for that specific compute:nova az.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-05-19 22:07:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sorry, there isn't any hard-coding of the az in tempest, but I think the random az here is what's causing problems."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-05-19 22:21:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If you look at another change that's passing the neutron jobs, the device_owner is 'compute:None':

http://logs.openstack.org/27/183727/2/check/check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full/3beee1a/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_2015-05-15_23_31_46_345

So instance.availability_zone in these tests is None but getting it from the az module is a random value."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-05-19 22:30:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Your problem is down in the nova.virt.libvirt.vif code, the port isn't created with the proper az there, it's None:

http://logs.openstack.org/76/181776/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full/d32662d/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_2015-05-12_08_50_45_420

So you'd also need to make this change there."}, {'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2015-05-20 19:24:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Matt, the port in neutron is created in the code I've changed. I can't see anywhere in the vif.py code that is creating neutron ports."}, {'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2015-05-20 19:36:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

OK I think I know what may be going on. When searching for ports it filters on the device_owner attribute in the port. If the instance has changed AZs (maybe tempest does this) the port isn't found. 

I don't think there is any reason to filter on device owner when we are already filtering on device id which is all we need in this case I think"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-05-20 20:59:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah sorry about the vif red herring, I saw that in the logs but it was just a part of code that was logging the entire instance and all of it's attributes.

I don't *think* tempest is changing availability zones but I'm not entirely sure (haven't dug in).  If this is consistently failing in the same tests, it'd be worth checking those tests in tempest to see if they are mucking with AZ somehow."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-05-20 21:14:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Taking the fixed IP address from the console log in the test failure, I found the device_id uuid in the n-cpu logs for the first test failure and then took that device_id (port_id) into the neutron server log and found this:

http://logs.openstack.org/76/181776/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full/d32662d/logs/screen-q-svc.txt.gz#_2015-05-12_08_50_51_089

So something is trying to find the port by device_owner="compute:nova", so figure out what that is.  Might be tempest.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-05-20 21:29:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-05-29 15:43:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sam, you might be interested in this:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169612'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2015-09-04 16:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This patch seems to have stalled, lets abandon it.
Please restore the patch if that is no longer true.

Any questions, please catch me via email or on IRC johnthetubaguy'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-23 20:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think this was fixed by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/446053/ in Pike.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-11 00:36:44.000000000', 'message': 'Create neutron ports with correct instance AZ value

When creating neutron ports nova was incorrectly setting the device_owner
attribute to compute:<instance.availability_zone> this value is the requested
instance AZ. This should use the get_instance_availability_zone method to
calculate the instance AZ.

Change-Id: Iec466e94eefac75ad0e0c0b81f012c1b48eb2bec
Closes-Bug: #1453629
'}]
commit_message:
Create neutron ports with correct instance AZ value

When creating neutron ports nova was incorrectly setting the device_owner
attribute to compute:<instance.availability_zone> this value is the requested
instance AZ. This should use the get_instance_availability_zone method to
calculate the instance AZ.

Change-Id: Iec466e94eefac75ad0e0c0b81f012c1b48eb2bec
Closes-Bug: #1453629

commit_message:
Skip reporting status for HA backup routers

The VPN plugin tries to check status for all VPN services, including
those which will never run there because the state of the router is
in 'backup' mode when using HA.

This patch adds an optimization in order to only report and check
the status when the service is not running in backup.

Co-Authored-By: Dongcan Ye <hellochosen@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1822921
Change-Id: I3505897a3a6bfb0f03a4c98b26d4a0de12cba73f

[{'created': '2019-04-23 13:39:07.000000000', 'message': 'plugins/ceph: Pass key data instead of interface object

The helper functions for configuring keys will be used with both
RelationBase- and Endpoint-based interfaces.  They have different
mechanics to get to relation attributs (function calls vs.
properties).

The only interface attribute we use is in the Ceph keyring helper
functions is the key data, so just pass that instead of the
interace object and let it be the callers job of unpacking the
data as the interface they use require.

Change-Id: If1d645f4708e27b724f93cac0e14431137c885d7

commit_message:
plugins/ceph: Pass key data instead of interface object

The helper functions for configuring keys will be used with both
RelationBase- and Endpoint-based interfaces.  They have different
mechanics to get to relation attributes (function calls vs.
properties).

The only interface attribute we use is the key data, so just pass
that instead of the interace object and let it be the callers job
to unpack the data as the interface they use require.

Change-Id: If1d645f4708e27b724f93cac0e14431137c885d7

subject: Create stable/stein branch for ldappool
messages:
[{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-04-22 13:31:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-04-22 13:50:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2019-04-22 14:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-04-23 10:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I bet this has been discussed previously, but is there any reason why this is cycle-independent, if you end up cutting a openstack-cycle-tied stable branch every cycle?'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-04-23 15:13:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I bet this has been discussed previously, but is there any reason
 > why this is cycle-independent, if you end up cutting a
 > openstack-cycle-tied stable branch every cycle?

I was surprised this had branches and that's why it's happening late.

We made this cycle independent here: https://review.opendev.org/568316

As the commit message says, usually this library sees hardly any changes. We had some extra activity on it this cycle but probably next cycle will be quiet again.

I'm not sure whether this really needs a new branch except that it  already has pike-rocky branches."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-04-23 18:38:25.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I think we really don't need branches for this library, we usually treat it more like an independent external dependency. If we decide we need branches, we can always create them later."}]

subject: Trivial change to README.md as part of new hire onboarding
messages:
[{'account_id': 30300, 'date': '2019-04-22 14:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-04-22 14:12:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30300, 'date': '2019-04-23 16:58:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This is only a test review, and is not meant to be pushed to master.'}]

commit_message:
Revert "Temporarily disable inap-mtl01 for maintenance"

commit_message:
Delete approved template in move_implemented_specs

The move_implemented_specs tool was cleverly removing the
implemented/<release>-template.rst link so it didn't clutter up the
TOC. This patch whacks the approved/<release>-template.rst link as well.

Change-Id: Icf75ce9d27a6ca5cdfcc147698d79669bbfbdba8

commit_message:
VMware: map instance to DRS vm group

In case of VMware virt driver, vcenter cluster is exposed as compute node.
A cluster can have upto 64 ESXi hosts. After nova scheduler selects a
compute node, VMware virt driver uses the vcenter cluster reference
that corresponds to the compute node to place the instance.
Dynamic Resource Scheduler (DRS) on vcenter cluster is responsible for
selecting a specific ESXi host to power on the virtual machine.

DRS has ability to group ESXi hosts logically as host groups and
virtual machines to vm groups. Admin can define host group to
vm group policy on vcenter.

This spec describes how to schedule instances to specific
compute node that has a given vm group and associate OpenStack instance
to that vm group.

Change-Id: I28569d1866dc30cf69dcaa7eec20c9c04a89a7e4
blueprint: vmware-vm-groups

Besides the comments with a couple of comments:

* Rado's comment about "how do we ensure use of the root pool" are pretty important for how we model this stuff.
* Is the plan here that all inventory will be on a resource pool (or below) or that some inventory will be on the root provider (that represents the cluster)?'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-03-14 16:46:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(12 comments)

A few nits to address inline, but since this is essentially proposing to use the new update_provider_tree() interface in the vcenter driver, I'm supportive of this spec.

One important thing that should be added to the spec, however, is that the virt driver under no circumstances should be creating allocations (or adjusting allocations) that have been made against the resource providers involved in the cluster. This means that there should be nothing in the vcenter virt driver that moves instances around in the cluster. Otherwise, the accounting of resources will get seriously messed up.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 16929, 'date': '2018-03-14 21:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Giridhar, thanks for your patience with my questions for understanding.'}, {'account_id': 16929, 'date': '2018-03-19 18:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)

Matt,
Thanks for your time to review this spec.'}, {'account_id': 16929, 'date': '2018-03-19 18:18:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

Chris,
Thanks for the review.'}, {'account_id': 16929, 'date': '2018-03-19 22:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16929, 'date': '2018-03-20 19:08:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-03-21 16:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9172, 'date': '2018-03-27 08:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-11 15:32:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

You need to be very clear in this spec why you want to change certain things about the vmware virt driver. I believe it is best to solve the "direct this tenant to this set of compute hosts" by using aggregates, not nested resource providers, and using the functionality that Dan Smith is creating with the placement request filters [1] to direct the scheduler to place instances for tenant X on aggregate Y.

Secondly, what you really are looking for is a complex *quota management* system. The changes you propose to the virt driver to modify how *inventory* is tracked is not really relevant to that basic use case. Quotas are reservable units of some resource. Inventory tracking doesn't care about quotas of specific tenants (a resource provider doesn't care or know that a particular tenant "should" get some part of its resources). Similarly, allocations are not the same as quotas. Allocations represent what has been claimed by a consumer on a provider. Allocations do not represent what *might be claimed* in the future nor do they represent a "well, take this but be able to give up this amount" logic that is required to do the kind of "burstable quota" that you describe in the use case section here.

So, in short, I think it's best to rework this spec to have the vmware virt driver adopt the update_provider_tree() virt driver API method and create resource provider records representing the things that will host instances. I would recommend *not* doing nested providers and just add compute node resource providers representing the vcenter cluster as new root providers and using aggregates to associate tenants to individual hosts.

The only thing that adding individual hosts as child providers to a root provider representing the "resource pool" would give you is a way to report aggregate inventory and usage information for the entire resource pool, if that is useful. Not sure if it is or isn't...

Best,

-jay

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544585/'}, {'account_id': 16929, 'date': '2018-04-19 19:21:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(3 comments)

Hi Jay,
Sorry about the late response. 
 > (4 comments)
 > 
 > You need to be very clear in this spec why you want to change
 > certain things about the vmware virt driver. I believe it is best
 > to solve the "direct this tenant to this set of compute hosts" by
 > using aggregates, not nested resource providers, and using the
 > functionality that Dan Smith is creating with the placement request
 > filters [1] to direct the scheduler to place instances for tenant X
 > on aggregate Y.
 > 
The main motivation of this spec is not about directing tenant to specific compute nodes, instead directing placement of instances to specific vcenter resource pools.  

 > Secondly, what you really are looking for is a complex *quota
 > management* system. The changes you propose to the virt driver to
 > modify how *inventory* is tracked is not really relevant to that
 > basic use case. Quotas are reservable units of some resource.
 > Inventory tracking doesn't care about quotas of specific tenants (a
 > resource provider doesn't care or know that a particular tenant
 > "should" get some part of its resources). Similarly, allocations
 > are not the same as quotas. Allocations represent what has been
 > claimed by a consumer on a provider. Allocations do not represent
 > what *might be claimed* in the future nor do they represent a
 > "well, take this but be able to give up this amount" logic that is
 > required to do the kind of "burstable quota" that you describe in
 > the use case section here.
 > 
 > So, in short, I think it's best to rework this spec to have the
 > vmware virt driver adopt the update_provider_tree() virt driver API
 > method and create resource provider records representing the things
 > that will host instances. I would recommend *not* doing nested
 > providers and just add compute node resource providers representing
 > the vcenter cluster as new root providers and using aggregates to
 > associate tenants to individual hosts.
 > 

For sure, the implementation will be using update_provider_tree(). vcenter resource pools are the ones hosting the instance and hence we need to create resource providers. The reason we need to use nested resource providers for vcenter resource pools is because they are not independent of vcenter cluster. The hierarchical relationship between vcenter cluster and resource pool is better represented using the nested resource provider to ensure that the cpu and memory resources are tracked correctly.

 > The only thing that adding individual hosts as child providers to a
 > root provider representing the "resource pool" would give you is a
 > way to report aggregate inventory and usage information for the
 > entire resource pool, if that is useful. Not sure if it is or
 > isn't...
 > 
 > Best,
 > 
 > -jay
 > 
 > [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544585/'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-19 19:31:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
VMware: place instances on resource pool

In case of VMware virt driver, vcenter cluster is exposed
as compute node. A cluster can have upto 64 ESXi hosts.
Vcenter resource pool allows to compartmentalize the
CPU and memory to different organizations/tenants.
Resource pools can be configured to have reservation and
limit values for CPU and memory.

This specification attempts to provide a workflow for placing
instances on a specific VMware vcenter resource pool.

blueprint: vmware-resource-pool
Change-Id: Ibd3aae2cff09be1f46594b23fb60d79b1bd46ebf

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is maintained
project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I3c5d4e068ee5f2919a4061e8f7b78f724cd61724
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix regression in glance client call

In [0] the way parameters are passed to the glance client was changed.
Sadly one required argument was dropped during this, we need to insert
it again in order to fix e.g. rbd backend usage.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/614351

Change-Id: I5a4cfb3c9b8125eca4f6c9561d3023537e606a93
Closes-Bug: 1803717

commit_message:
Consider a BOSS card a RAID controller

This fixes the is_raid_controller method so that it returns true
for a BOSS controller in addition to normal RAID controllers.

commit_message:
Replace git.openstack.org URLs with opendev.org URLs

1. Replace git.openstack.org URLs with opendev.org URLs
2. update "nova" command to "openstack"
3. remove the unnecessary "neutron-api"

Change-Id: Ib95d8e1b7588173d51d0e225eeb9d05b806ca171

exit code for the function will be 1 if the previous command failed
if/then condition intercepts that

testing commit just to show that autopep8 was way less
impact on exisitng pep8 complient code bases like nova.

not itended to merge.

- Removing the openstack-tox-pep8 and openstack-tox-py27 jobs since
they are defined in the project's config [1].
- Removing the periodic stable jobs; we really don't use them so there's
no need to use resources running them.

the 36 template in the project [1] and py35 testing is being dropped.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/vmware-nsx/blob/master/.zuul.yaml

commit_message:
update vmware-nsx related jobs

This patch updates the vmware-nsx, vmware-nsxlib and
vmware-nsx-tempest-plugin jobs by:
- Removing a number of templates that belong in-repo such as
openstack-python-jobs and check-requirements, etc..
- Removing the periodic jobs; we don't use them so they are just using
resources by running. The periodic job with neutron-lib master is
kept for ensuring neutron-lib/master is not breaking consumers.

For corresponding in-repo changes please see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/652642/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/653008/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/653009/

Change-Id: I1b0496d3048f832cd60be70703a23cc712f8693d

'}, {'created': '2019-01-28 10:55:18.000000000', 'message': 'placement: Extract the service from Nova

This change fully extracts the Placement service from Nova, replacing
the original service in all roles with the now independent service.

This is mostly code motion between the two with the only addition being
the `placement-manage db sync` call required to initialise the now
separate placement database ahead of the service starting.

Upgrade tasks are also missing from this initial change and will be
worked on independently of this initial deployment focused change.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632057/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/624335/

'}, {'created': '2019-02-07 12:36:28.000000000', 'message': 'placement: Introduce an extracted PlacementAPI service

This change introduces an optional extracted version of the Placement
service into TripleO. This extracted version will only be required once
the Placement service is fully removed from Nova during the T cycle
(previously S but delayed) at which point the corresponding
NovaPlacement service will also be removed from TripleO.

The majority of this change is code motion between the original
NovaPlacement service and the new PlacementAPI service. There is some
limited additional logic introduced in the base Nova puppet template to
ensure we configure `nova.conf` to use the correct placement backend.

Upgrades from the original NovaPlacement service to the extracted
PlacementAPI service are not currently supported by this change and will
be worked on independently during the Train cycle.

For now the `scenario004-standalone` CI job is also modified to test the
deployment of the new service during Stein.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/624335/
Change-Id: I9e3287bcbe9d317f32bf6b468c6ee17f04b6fff9

commit_message:
placement: Introduce an extracted PlacementAPI service

This change introduces an optional extracted version of the Placement
service into TripleO. This extracted version will only be required once
the Placement service is fully removed from Nova during the T cycle
(previously S but delayed) at which point the corresponding
NovaPlacement service will also be removed from TripleO.

The majority of this change is code motion between the original
NovaPlacement service and the new PlacementAPI service.

Upgrades from the original NovaPlacement service to the extracted
PlacementAPI service are not currently supported by this change and will
be worked on independently during the Train cycle.

Co-authored-by: mschuppert@redhat.com

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/624335/
Change-Id: I9e3287bcbe9d317f32bf6b468c6ee17f04b6fff9

commit_message:
Move ceph OSD to LVM based backend

Since nautilus, the supported store backend is LVM which can use a block
device directly (not loopback) or a LVM logical volume for OSDs.

This patch is creating a LVM structure to create the OSD used to
validate Ceph to prepare p-o-i to switching to Nautilus.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/650263/
Change-Id: I3072af82fd2e4ae45b13c25a81211cded741aa68

commit_message:
Add python36-charm-jobs project template

Charm projects are using the python35-charm-jobs
for their testing which should be moved to py36
and drop the py35 testing.

This commit adds the new python36-charm-jobs project
template which run py36 jobs.

Change-Id: I1de11884fa3f14f4aed3e9d8d301bf7102de8e81

commit_message:
update git.openstack in _DEFAULT_REQS_DIR

This patch changes the _DEFAULT_REQS_DIR constant to use opendev.org
rather than git.openstack.org in project-requirements-change.py to
address failures such as [1].

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I57ef50b7f210cd2ddb934c283652c565028774ec

commit_message:
Use py36 instead of py35 for periodic master jobs

OpenStack Train will test on py36 instead of py35, change the periodic
master jobs periodic-jobs-with-X-master to use py36.

Leave openstack-tox-py35-with-neutron-lib-master and -with-ovsdbapp
in for now, we first need to change a few users.

Change-Id: Ie2941e89e543db406db5a89666dfcb576e3e8f96

commit_message:
Add entry_point for oslo policy scripts

With the setup.cfg entry it can  be called directly from
oslo.policy.

$oslopolicy-policy-generator --namespace heat

This will get the effective policy thats being executed.

Change-Id: Iad2e71819f4847f47dd17d3cd4afa78e6b3f52a7
Story: #2005055
Task: 29573

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I4bcef964d06b56228a9566248458e7bccedf824d

subject: Ensure that global-requirement-pins.txt is applied
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-04-22 21:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-04-23 01:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-04-23 08:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-22 21:55:59.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that global-requirement-pins.txt is applied

In the previous repo build process, we had global constraints which
override upper constraints and anything set in the roles. This was
essential for two purposes:

1. To enable us to pin things that were not in upper constraints. eg: pip,
   setuptools, wheel
2. To enable us to pin things which were in upper constraints, but broken.
   This would usually be a temporary measure until upper constraints was
   fixed.

This patch extracts the global pins from global-requirement-pins.txt
into a list and sets 'venv_build_global_constraints' to the resulting
list so that it is applied to all venvs built.

In order to reliably find this file without using a hard-coded path, we
implement a change to the wrapper script to set the path in it in a
similar manner to that implemented for the inventory path.

Depends-On: I9ae3ef19c863b9237a51d2fcd6f4ebce1a9ebad7
Change-Id: I138fe1c8ea80fe71244ab0dc6497cfc6d7bdf953
(cherry picked from commit 0635dfbccc98bc2beb308d2b30ddbaf404201087)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that global-requirement-pins.txt is applied

In the previous repo build process, we had global constraints which
override upper constraints and anything set in the roles. This was
essential for two purposes:

1. To enable us to pin things that were not in upper constraints. eg: pip,
   setuptools, wheel
2. To enable us to pin things which were in upper constraints, but broken.
   This would usually be a temporary measure until upper constraints was
   fixed.

This patch extracts the global pins from global-requirement-pins.txt
into a list and sets 'venv_build_global_constraints' to the resulting
list so that it is applied to all venvs built.

In order to reliably find this file without using a hard-coded path, we
implement a change to the wrapper script to set the path in it in a
similar manner to that implemented for the inventory path.

Depends-On: I9ae3ef19c863b9237a51d2fcd6f4ebce1a9ebad7
Change-Id: I138fe1c8ea80fe71244ab0dc6497cfc6d7bdf953
(cherry picked from commit 0635dfbccc98bc2beb308d2b30ddbaf404201087)

commit_message:
Remove reinstall of RPMs

If we update the images and then we do reinstall it fails since updated
version if newer that one installed and reinstall cannot find the old
version anymore:

sudo /usr/bin/dnf -y '--exclude=python2*' reinstall python3-setuptools
 Installed package python3-setuptools-39.2.0-6.fc28.noarch not available.

Change-Id: I7f32ea045d70caa99a389f1681dcedc2d0eac898
Closes-Bug: #1823912

commit_message:
Add --config-download-only

A new CLI argument, --config-download-only, has been added which can be
used to skip the stack create/update and only run the config-download
workflow to apply the software configuration.

Change-Id: I6f3e8a943d49fea65e855d76e3c3d56f9eb8e41b

subject: Move cinderlib to cycle-trailing
messages: [{'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-04-22 08:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-22 13:57:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nCinderlib consumes cinder to expose driver functionality, so even though it's a little different from our other cycle-trailing deliverables, I think it is appropriate to have this as something that gets releases after everything else."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-04-23 10:00:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-22 08:36:10.000000000', 'message': 'Move cinderlib to cycle-trailing

Cinderlib was added late in the Stein cycle, so it went in with the
independent release model, but the appropriate model is cycle-trailing.

Cinderlib is different from other OpenStack libraries.  It provides an
object oriented abstraction of the Cinder drivers for the purpose of
consuming them outside of OpenStack.  Using the Cinder drivers means
that it has the Cinder project as a dependency and needs it to be
released before the cinderlib release. This is why the cycle-trailing
release model is the most appropriate.

This patch adds cinderlib to the Train release as a cycle-trailing
project.

Change-Id: I4bc7068e2ac41af2b879d382e73cfd16e6f2927c
'}]
commit_message:
Move cinderlib to cycle-trailing

Cinderlib was added late in the Stein cycle, so it went in with the
independent release model, but the appropriate model is cycle-trailing.

Cinderlib is different from other OpenStack libraries.  It provides an
object oriented abstraction of the Cinder drivers for the purpose of
consuming them outside of OpenStack.  Using the Cinder drivers means
that it has the Cinder project as a dependency and needs it to be
released before the cinderlib release. This is why the cycle-trailing
release model is the most appropriate.

This patch adds cinderlib to the Train release as a cycle-trailing
project.

Change-Id: I4bc7068e2ac41af2b879d382e73cfd16e6f2927c

commit_message:
Allow users to choose to flattern volumes

Expose rbd_flatten_volume_from_snapshot to the user which allows
then to flatten volumes created from snapshots to remove
dependency from volume to snapshot.

Change-Id: I22a3c82535efac5334dd5deaadbba0dd1eae83ab
Closes-Bug: #1824582

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-09 03:50:55.000000000', 'message': "Fix Angular errors in openstack_auth

Angular errors on login page are caused by loading ngdetails view.
Although registration of URL for ngdetails is executed on top level
of Horizon, ngdetails view is not needed to be loaded in login page,
i.e. openstack_auth side.
To fix this issue, this patch moves registration of URL for ngdetails
into openstack_dashboard side.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/test/urls.py
	openstack_dashboard/urls.py

The above conflicts are caused by bp/django2-support which landed in Rocky,
particully by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527323/12.

Another problem:

ngdetails url doesn't have project prefix after Ocata release, pls see:
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/stable/ocata/ \
    openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.service.js#L59
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/stable/pike/ \
    openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.service.js#L69

So the following simple changes need to be made in urls.py
in addition to the primitive backport patches.

-ngdetails_url = url(r'^ngdetails/',
+ngdetails_url = url(r'^project/ngdetails/',

Change-Id: Ib039417b4e666c2341f17ac05fd7723bc758816c
Closes-Bug: #1754133
Closes-Bug: #1753557
(cherry picked from commit f494c6f2d475bfc936b78fda7ce11ed4d46c7224)
(cherry picked from commit 6f6f46dc6d2f38719b114a80edabe2eb01b1ab06)
Signed-off-by: Zhang Hua <joshua.zhang@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fix Angular errors in openstack_auth

Angular errors on login page are caused by loading ngdetails view.
Although registration of URL for ngdetails is executed on top level
of Horizon, ngdetails view is not needed to be loaded in login page,
i.e. openstack_auth side.
To fix this issue, this patch moves registration of URL for ngdetails
into openstack_dashboard side.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/test/urls.py
	openstack_dashboard/urls.py

The above conflicts are caused by bp/django2-support which landed in Rocky,
particully by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527323/12.

Another problem:

ngdetails url doesn't have project prefix after Ocata release, pls see:
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/stable/ocata/ \
    openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.service.js#L59
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/stable/pike/ \
    openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.service.js#L69

So the following simple changes need to be made in urls.py
in addition to the primitive backport patches.

-ngdetails_url = url(r'^ngdetails/',
+ngdetails_url = url(r'^project/ngdetails/',

Change-Id: Ib039417b4e666c2341f17ac05fd7723bc758816c
Closes-Bug: #1754133
Closes-Bug: #1753557
(cherry picked from commit f494c6f2d475bfc936b78fda7ce11ed4d46c7224)
(cherry picked from commit 6f6f46dc6d2f38719b114a80edabe2eb01b1ab06)
Signed-off-by: Zhang Hua <joshua.zhang@canonical.com>

commit_message:
GATE CHECK for TripleO

This change is used to check the health of our stable branch gate jobs
in the most direct way possible, by running the real gates on a noop
change.

Change-Id: I0cbf9ffb8552411e4dd891c38702ff8d1f6db5b1

[{'created': '2019-04-04 13:20:31.000000000', 'message': "WIP Retry to declare a queue after internal error

Closes-Bug: [1]
Without this commit, the client can lose the messages, because the
client does not handler the 'AMQP internal error 541',
read here [2] for details.
The fix retries to create the queue after a delay.
When the virtual-host is ready the declare does not fail.
This is a rare condiction, please read the bug [1] for details.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1822778
[2] https://www.rabbitmq.com/amqp-0-9-1-reference.html

Change-Id: I7ab1f9d21ebb807285bf1422bc14cc6e07dcd32a

commit_message:
Retry to declare a queue after internal error

Without this commit, the client can lose the messages, because the
client does not handler the 'AMQP internal error 541',
read here [2] for details.
The fix retries to create the queue after a delay.
When the virtual-host is ready the declare does not fail.
This is a rare condiction, please read the bug [1] for details.

Closes-Bug: #1822778

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1822778
[2] https://www.rabbitmq.com/amqp-0-9-1-reference.html

Change-Id: I7ab1f9d21ebb807285bf1422bc14cc6e07dcd32a

1. Remove the task that removes the vitrage_collector container, which
   was added in the Stein cycle to clean up this container which is no
   longer deployed.

2. Remove globals.yml configuration in CI to disable Heat for upgrade
   jobs. Heat is now enabled in the previous release (Stein).

3. Remove the deprecated variable cinder_iscsi_helper, which was renamed
   to cinder_target_helper in Stein.

Change-Id: I774bf395e0bdd4db9c20c6289a22cf059fa42e1a
'}]
commit_message:
Do some Train TODOs

Make an early start on the TODOs for the Train cycle.

1. Remove the task that removes the vitrage_collector container, which
   was added in the Stein cycle to clean up this container which is no
   longer deployed.

2. Remove globals.yml configuration in CI to disable Heat for upgrade
   jobs. Heat is now enabled in the previous release (Stein).

3. Remove the deprecated variable cinder_iscsi_helper, which was renamed
   to cinder_target_helper in Stein.

Change-Id: I774bf395e0bdd4db9c20c6289a22cf059fa42e1a

commit_message:
Fetch upper constraints from opendev.org

the imagebuild/common/generate_upper_constraints.sh
is currently failing as the curl command in this file does not
handle redirects.

Instead of allowing redirects, use the proper current link to the
upper constraints file.

Change-Id: I92c5bfa65ba149687f61172c2a89ff38660a58cf

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I26cd640cfea391849c14985d603f7272edb3edc9

commit_message:
Ensure non-empty libvirt <loader/> tag

When dynamic emulator changes domain boot mode, make sure
that no empty <loader> tag is ever added into the domain
configuration because it fails domain to boot later on.

Whenever emulator's boot mode computation ends up in an
empty boot loader path, just remove the entire <loader>
tag from domain configuration effectively implying default
boot mode.

Change-Id: Icbf1eaa742da4ae6e9dd3ce4e6eb3a4c5a6f724f
